H0.text: mRNA is what leaves the nucleus after exons are cut out.

H1.text: The gene leaves the nucleus after exons are cut out.

H2.text: DNA is what leaves the nucleus after exons are cut out.

H3.text: RNA is what leaves the nucleus after exons are cut out.

A4.text: Once processed, the mature mRNA is exported from the nucleus to the cytoplasm for translation.

A5.text: Because eukaryotic transcription and translation is compartmentally separated, eukaryotic mRNAs must be exported from the nucleus to the cytoplasmâ€”a process that may be regulated by different signaling pathways.

A6.text: once mature mRNA is generated, it is transported to the cytoplasm for translation.
